website_summaries.verdict: Great for gamers, as this drive works well with game consoles like Xbox and PlayStation, as well as the PC.
pros: Fairly fast with a USB 3.0 port
Cooperates with most Xbox and PlayStation setups
cons: Some expressed concerns over the quality of the plastic housing

website_summaries.verdict: A good, modern option from Seagate for extra storage and fast data transfer speeds out of the box.
pros: The exterior of the hard drive can resist common dents and scratches when carrying the device in a pocket
Does not require any additional software or power supply to work correctly
cons: The hard drive can stop working unexpectedly or may require formatting

customer_reviews.title: Complete Failure at Seven Months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive on August 25, 2016. It failed on March 1, 2017. After exploring all solutions with Seagate, they confirmed that the drive was dead. The only option they offered was a $500+ file recovery. Until I asked, Seagate did not even mention honoring the product's warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Hart

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive sat on my desk and was used maybe 20 times since I purchased it. 6 months later it wouldn't turn on. I noticed that the connection where the USB plugs into the device was loose. I opened the casing to expose the hard drive only to find that the USB connector was barely attached with solder at 2 different points and TAPED down with metallic tape. A port where a cable is plugged and unplugged consistently should be attached more firmly with more than just 2 dots of solder and tape... Now i'm out 60 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Nubez

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Sinking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my Xbox one about two months it's doesn't move around and it stop working approximately two days ago, tried getting in contact with seller but haven't got anywhere, the saved files are really important to me and I hooked it up to my laptop and nothing
customer_reviews.author: Collision_al

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 months later - complete failure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than 4 months ago since it's a recommended product and the price was right, but it failed magnificently and without any warning. Tried everything, even pulling it out of the casing and using a SATA -> USB adapter from another computer to recover. No dice, the thing was a brick. I had the files professionally recovered the same day. Seagate responded to my inquiry later saying they would not be honoring the warranty because I removed the drive from its casing. That's ok, I didn't want another defective drive anyway, Seagate. I put that thing through a shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 8 months of use in PS4
customer_reviews.text: Update: This product failed after 8 months of use. The PS4 no longer recognizes it. I plug it into my PC and the PC will not recognize it. It is now outside of any sort of support (bought in July, support was up in Septemeber, convenient, eh?) Be wary of purchasing. ------- Works perfectly for my PS4. Just plugged it in to the USB port on the PS4 and it asked to format it. I said yes and about 3 minutes later it was ready to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Partitions Cannot be read consistently on Mac (El Capitan)
customer_reviews.text: i used this once with Time Machine and then nearly 6 months later tried to take another backup snapshot. The snapshots in Time Machine are supposed to be incremental yet the program ran for nearly a whole 24 hours to backup under 50 GB of data. At first i thought Time machine was the problem so shut the application and restarted but then i could not see the disks under Finder either. Ran Disk utility and then each time it said it was unmounting the disk and then waiting for the disk to re-appear this happend so many times that i finally gave up and decided to let others know - DONT TRUST THIS WITH YOUR BACKUPS... especially Mac users
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Tanna

customer_reviews.title: Love This Drive!
customer_reviews.text: I had installed an internal hard drive that was the same brand on my laptop and it seemed not as good. But this particular external drive is a BEAST. Super fast transfer, lightweight, and very portable, it's been around the world with me and still going strong. I need another hard drive and will definitely opt for this one. Important to note (maybe) that I made my purchase in 2016 and perhaps the quality of it has changed since then (like many things being made more cheaply nowadays), but I've had luck with this almost 3 years old drive so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dorian M.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Hard drives like this should easily last 2 years. This one did not. After reading some of the other reviews, it almost appears like Seagate intentionally designed some of these to fail right around the 2 year mark (I bought my HDD on October 15th of 2016 and it failed October 10th of 2018). I used the drive as an expansion to my xbox one, so luckily i didn't exactly lose any data. However, since it's just been plugged into my xbox and left virtually untouched for two years this should go to show have poorly this HDD was made. I will eventually buy a replacement, but it wont be giving Seagate anymore money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than a year. Almost impossible to ...
customer_reviews.text: Dead in less than a year. Almost impossible to find out what the warranty is, because they do not put it in the documentation. You have to get it off the drive, which is dead. It is a hassle to find the warranty period on the website. (You have to enter the part number and serial number, but they say you can enter the model number.) Of course the return is a hassle, and I need the drive now, so I won't be taking advantage of the return policy, such as it is. Bottom line: the warranty is worthless, and the drive should last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: K. Arbuckle

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE OUT OF THE BOX
customer_reviews.text: This unit was defective out of the box. It would only constantly beep and my computer wouldn't recognize it. I took it (along with my new computer) into my computer shop and they tried it with two of their computers. Same result, their computers wouldn't recognize it. I've had no problem with Seagate products in the past, unfortunately that wasn't the case this time. I'll reorder a different product.
customer_reviews.author: GLMamerow

customer_reviews.title: Really upset about the quality of this harddrive, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Really upset about the quality of this harddrive, and would caution people against purchasing it. I bought one on May 31, 2016 to store my business photos/videos/Adobe project files. Without any trauma or indication of failure, the harddrive stopped working on Friday, March 31, 2017. I'm currently working on shelling out $300-$600 to have the data from the drive recovered. Do yourself a favor, and always have your business information backed up in a cloud too. But bottom line is, this drive should not have failed after <1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: POS and even worse warranty support.
customer_reviews.text: Forget about warranty support. Item died while still in warranty period. Emailed Seagate, they couldn’t find the serial number I provided until I sent them a picture of the label clearly showing the SN...they claimed that warranty expired in 7/16...I didn’t even order it until 11/16 (arrived from Amazon as NIB, sealed). Amazon refuses to help. No worries, I have some time next week, I’ll start a small court action to recoup the cost of the drive. It’ll cost Seagate far more then the cost of replacing the item just to defend the small claims case.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: FAILURE FAILURE FAILURE
customer_reviews.text: As a photography major, I live off hard drives. Within the first 3 months I had issues formatting the drive to work on a Mac, I had to transfer everything off of the drive which took just over an hour. formatting it took no time at all but redownloading took over 2 hours. Later that month my friend (who was using the same drive at the time) had hers fail without warning. She couldn't recover her files. Today, 6 months after I bought the drive, my failed too. Will not let me access my photos without formatting everything. Will never be purchasing another Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Bodo

customer_reviews.title: Heed the Warnings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive in September 2017 as a backup for old personal files, videos and photos. I really liked it at first because it was compact, fast and had great reviews when I purchased it. It's March 2020 at the time of this writing and the drive has completely failed. I've lost decades of memories and important files. I'm currently researching if there is a way to recover my files. I'm utterly heartbroken and based on this experience, would never purchase a Seagate brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Dazzle Driller

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: I have an IMac, and bought the Seagate for extra storage of my photographs. I tried 3 times to format the hard drive using exFAT / FAT32 But Seagate wanted me to install their software on my computer. So I called Seagate’s technical support number, and was informed to format the drive to Mac Journal. Not what I wanted, but did it anyway. Now! Less than a week later, the hard drive is corrupted and unable to write correctly. My Beach ball just spins and spins when I click on any of the files on the drive. Please, please, please avoid and save yourself headaches and problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: When you read bad reviews you probably say to yourself "oh, that won't happen to me. This thing is gonna work for me, that person probably had a defective item". That's exactly what I said to myself. I bought this way back in September to use it as extended storage on my ps4 and just recently it stopped working. The ps4 wont recognize it, my pc wont recognize it, nothing. All it does now is just shine its light whenever it's plugged in. The disk doesn't even spin any more. Don't buy this, you'll eventually regret it. How I want a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper1448

customer_reviews.title: As an Amazon best seller and recommended product I expected great things from ...
customer_reviews.text: As an Amazon best seller and recommended product I expected great things from this item. It lasted 2 months and crashed. Luckily we ordered the protection plan and are going through the hassle to try and recover our data. Save your time and money and go with a different product Update: Have been on the phone 4 times and hold for over an hour with no resolution. So much of a hassle I am starting to wonder if its worth it, but really need info from drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: You might want to check out the Western Digital drives before purchasing!
customer_reviews.text: Well here's my problem - I purchased three of these in April of 2016, and two already have issues. Flaky behavior and failing the on-board SeaTools diagnostics. Yes I do rotate these for daily backups, so they are constantly in use, but I don't think that daily use, or every other day, should be too much work for these drives. I'm disappointed that they only came with a one year warranty, whereas the Western Digital (4TB My Passport WDBYFT0040BBK-WESN) drives come with a two year warranty. That says to me that Western Digital puts more faith in their drives, than Seagate has with theirs. I guess I will be replacing these with the Western Digital 4TB drives.......
customer_reviews.author: Jef Boutin

customer_reviews.title: FAILED one year later
customer_reviews.text: Well, that was fun. $100 for a drive that only lasted a little over a year, and took a lot of good data with it. Seagate support says too bad, it was a "child" drive of a parent drive, and therefore is disqualified for any support. But I bought it from Amazon, from you, directly...I say. This is support for a failed product on amazon? Great, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in KC

customer_reviews.title: Problematic since day ONE
customer_reviews.text: This drive has been problematic since day one. It was always very finicky and any little bit of contact with the device would cause it to disconnect. I got a replacement through the warranty which came back as "Recertified", i.e. refurbished. I have mostly over the years tried to be careful and tolerated the occasional disconnect when I would accidentally nudge it. Now it seems that it has failed completely, and it is also out of warranty (>2 years since purchase). So I would not recommend this drive. There is just not enough protection of internal components to prevent errors from a slight amount of movement.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Evie Salomon

customer_reviews.title: which are not bad sectors but highly potential to become
customer_reviews.text: I bought couple of this to install my desktop. Many people talked that recent Seagate HDDs die fast. It will, if you do NOT full format the HDD before you use it. These days HDDs are so big, but manufacturers don't care about users' data at all. To avoid face at a sudden death or inaccessible HDD, put little more patience to your new HDD. Do you wanna lose 4TB data with quick format, or wanna be secured with full format? I found 129 slow sectors, which are not bad sectors but highly potential to become, & refreshed while I put 14-hour writing check for this disk, for example.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lee

customer_reviews.title: Hard drive doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive I received doesn't work (it isn't recognized as a working device on multiple laptops). The project I needed it for didn't start until after the return window (one month), so now I'm stuck with a paper weight. I'm surprised at the lack of quality control by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: bbshanny

customer_reviews.title: BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had this external drive for 3 years and when it got full my MacBook couldn't open it and I FREAKED OUT. Seagates customer service recovered all my data for free and they sent my data back on a brand new 4T external hard drive (and I had the 1T originally). It took them only 2 weeks to get it back to me and I bought a 5T during that time, but I am just so relieved and satisfied with their service, I'm definitely a Seagates customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Nat B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with Sony Blueray Player
customer_reviews.text: I used the drive to copy files over USB from my laptop then physically move the drive a Sony Blueray player to play the files. The laptop was a Lenovo Windows 7 and Sony Blueray player is a BDP-S3500. The file transfer was very fast from the laptop and the Blueray play worked flawlessly with the drive. The drive is small with a hard plastic case so it is not at all ruggedized and for my application though its perfect. Dont be taken aback by it light weight if you dont might it not be ruggedized, it work well.
customer_reviews.author: rkruz

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband and as always with my reviews, I use the products awhile before reviewing, so I can give honest review! The actual product size is very convenient (about the of a deck of playing cards, give ir take) ,it is a true TB and works well with his XBox1X . Perfect starter storage drive! The only issue we have had was transfering games, wiping it out to use on a different device... in a way not to lose games!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in March 2016 - it quit working in late October 2016. Warranty stinks and no exchange through Amazon. I'm sure most people expect something like this to remain functional longer than one year - I know I did!
customer_reviews.author: Customer in GA

customer_reviews.title: Backups!  It's not the programs that are important its the data!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for the amount of storage space. Comes pre - formated to NTFS which is a certain software company standard. Which is nice since you don't have to do the formatting before use. As a down side (Talking to you Linux folks) if you don't format to a ext4 file system on it, there is a performance loss since your files are being translated into NTFS format. With the USB3 spec, does pretty darn good. Handles large 8gig+ files with ease. Overall good deal.
customer_reviews.author: JustaDudeTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: not as fast as thought it would be but still, it works and didn't explode.
customer_reviews.text: it works. it stores files. it hasn't broken yet. it took forever to transfer my 3gb worth of files to this thing. seriously it took over 24 hours. and it was plugged in to a usb 3 port. not sure if that means anything. maybe that's normal. i honestly don't know. i wasn't in a hurry so it didn't cause me any stress or anything but i figure it's worth noting just in case.
customer_reviews.author: BuckTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Failed after less than 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great purchase, runs fast and it's slim and portable. After less than 2 weeks it stopped working completely with no warning signs. The drive makes a small noise as if it's trying to spin up but the platter is seizing. I never dropped it or even took it out of the room. Very disappointing- I cannot return because it's full of my personal data and it won't spin up so I can wipe it.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Quality for a good price. No extra work to save on my Mac.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a weekly back up for my 2012 Macbook Pro. It's been working great since I bought it. My sister has one too that she's had for 2+ years, which lead to me buying it. Only thing I would suggest is back up more frequently on the device and it will cut down time significantly. The first time my back up took 6+ hours for roughly 200 gb's of data. Every back up since then takes less than 5 minutes. My sister does hers yearly, takes like 6-8 hrs per time. Like I said, more frequently is better.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WITH PS4: MAKE SURE TO RESTART PS4
customer_reviews.text: At first it didn't work on my ps4, I tried formating it into a diff format and then saw someone mention that restarting their ps4 got it to work for them. So I reset my HD to default format (aka dont format it on your computer no need) Plug it in to your ps4, if your ps4 don't accept it then turn off your ps4 wait a bit and boot it up again. should work fine
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Lost my files
customer_reviews.text: Used it once, can't get it to show up on any computer since the first time. It's covered by the warranty, but as it looks like I just lost everything I put on there, I'm not too excited for round 2. Apparently I get to pay for the return shipping to their company AND they have some pretty ridiculous packaging requirements. Ratings are good overall so maybe the second one won't be a dud...but really how am I supposed to feel confident file dumping onto it after this...?
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: THE BARE BONES REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this hard drive to me, after having good results with his. I eventually purchased 3, all of which are still running strong as of May 2019, even under heavy daily use (including 2 accidental drops). These provide all the room my family needed. After formatting, HD space averaged around 960GB. I don't buy things to baby them; whether it's a fishing pole, work boots, or a hard drive like this one, I intend to get good use out of what I spend my money on. I have recommended these to others, and they have had nothing but positive results as well. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bare Bones

customer_reviews.title: Big Hard Drive, Crappy Enclosure
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months the enclosure just stopped working. The drive is fine. The cable started to malfunction early on, refusing to stay seated in the enclosure but one day when plugged in nothing happened at all. I have another Seagate drive with the same cable and adapter and switched them all out to make sure it was the enclosure. Really disappointed by both of these larger Seagate enclosures as my other 4TB one also has a cable that won't stay seated.
customer_reviews.author: Alan E

customer_reviews.title: This HD failed literally one month after going out-of-warranty
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few unfortunate experiences with Seagate drives in the past, but I know that data loss is largely still the 'nature of the beast' when it comes to computer storage, and after a trusted source recommended this drive, I figured perhaps Seagate's production quality was on the rise. This is my lesson learned-- the drive is now dead literally one month after going out of warranty. The irony is that I found this out because I accessed this drive specifically to burn a backup of what's on it. Instead, I'm trying to figure out which local data-retrieval service is going to get a few hundred dollars of my money. TAKE THE ONE-STAR REVIEWS SERIOUSLY AND BUY ANOTHER BRAND
customer_reviews.author: Sam M. Tannenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Started working now it’s a goner
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a couple of months and now it can’t recognize it and I can’t use it. Horrible feeling and really sucks. I have spent so many hours trying to fix the error but no luck. So disappointed. It’s been too long so I can’t get my money back. I have backed up my photos so I can continue working but this is a newer drive for me and was looking at it long term. Darn should have read the reviews
customer_reviews.author: J. Wenger

customer_reviews.title: Small = Modular
customer_reviews.text: Of course the main feature of this external hard drive that I like is the fact that it will store 4 TB of data. That’s the main thing. The price was right, under $90 when I bought it. I’m not impressed with the speed of data transfer, but then again this is a spinning hard drive, not solid state flash memory. So, the speed of transfer is inherent in the technology. Aside from the massive Storage capability, the one other feature is the fact that this device is small and does not take up a lot of space on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great, dependable drive for the money.
customer_reviews.text: A solid performer that never has an issue with linking to any computer...even when running on battery. The 1TB hard drive is more than enough to store all my photo's, music, and CAD files. I used it as a back up drive. Is it the best drive out there? Probably not. Is it the cheapest? Definitely not. It is however dependable and easy to use with minimal power unlike other 'portable' external hard drives that need an AC outlet to work. Its about the size of a deck of cards or wallet and fits right into your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: gwsjr425

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad one.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a precaution for when my Xbox ran out of storage. My 1tb in the Xbox still isn't full a year later, so I decided to use it for a PC I just built last week. Device is unrecognizable, the power light does not come on, and does not spin. I've troubleshooted for a whole day and can't get it to work. It's literally sat in a drawer unused for a year, turns out it's DOA. I'm not eligible for any support or claims since it's been so long, just my luck. IF YOU BUY THIS DRIVE, TEST IT IMMEDIATELY.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Marrero

customer_reviews.title: A good, serviceable drive
customer_reviews.text: The one drawback to the new laptop I got for my birthday was the rather small hard drive that came standard with it. 250 GB was simply too small to be of any use for me but the Seagate Expansion drive provides enough space for storage, and for running programs. Its somewhat bulkier than I would like because I have to travel a bit and every little bit of extra weight and bulk counts when i'm carrying my bag though an airport. Right now, 4 TB is plenty but I expect in another couple of years I may out grow this one as well. By then, I guess Seagate will have an even bigger drive.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin K. PattersonTop Contributor: Star Trek

customer_reviews.title: Got this for a decent price ,despite being older style, Windows runs fluent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for school and work. I do a lot of CAD, and utilize engineering software that takes up space. Oh and I love my Mac too much to go back to Windows. What I ended up doing was installing a copy of Windows 10 on this drive, so I can use my engineering software and school work on it. 1TB is more than enough! And my Mac still has lots of space left! Read and write speeds were great! They out did my expectations since Im used to Solid State Disk. This is a good school value drive.
customer_reviews.author: Erfan223

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Expansion Portable 2TB
customer_reviews.text: I can’t rate the Seagate Expansion Portable 2TB tech support as I haven’t had to call them for assistance. What can I say they build great products and I own several 2tb to 4tb hard drives using them for my gaming consoles and my computers. The drives work well even after I dropped one by accident. The drive still works like it was just bought yesterday. Amazon sells these with great prices as they are $5-$10 or cheaper than local retailers. Seagate is a brand I share with friends and family as recommendations
customer_reviews.author: Jaycoub

customer_reviews.title: 2 years old and complete fail
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive for two years connected to my Xbox One. The other day I started getting error messages stating that games were taking too long to load. Rebooted Xbox, tried other things, then came to the realization that it must be the external hard drive. After a few minutes if failed to boot. The blue light would come on, I could hear it spin up, but the Xbox, my Mac, and my PC failed to register it when I plugged it in. Not good. I've have hard drives that are years old and work reliably. My oldest Mac is from 2006. It has 4 WD hard drives and has never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Colauhu

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best thing since the thing before sliced bread. its convienent, easy to use and stores a ton of information, hence the T. I have downloaded about 6 HDD's onto it from different computers ive had through the years that I had saved, I thought that the data was lost on them forever, its a good thing i kept them, now I have modern access to them and didnt have to pay someone $80 or more PER HDD. This External is well worth the money and has worked flawlessly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Januchowski

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money - Don't expect it to last too long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive in May, 2018. Installation was a breeze and I was using it as a Time Machine Backup on my Mac, along with a second drive (nothing wrong with redundancy). It's now October 2018 and the drive is dead. It won't mount, Disk first Aid can't access it or repair it. It's not even heavy enough to be a $50 doorstop. This is the second Seagate drive that I've had drop dead. Just surprised that it only lasted 6 months. Don't skimp on a backup drive with this one. Looks good at first and will die just when you least expect it. No more seagate products for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marty S

customer_reviews.title: Too fragile to be portable
customer_reviews.text: Have had the 4TB drive for 4 years. It was generally reliable and speedy. Until one day it fell off the shelf it was stored on (about a 3 foot drop). No visible external damage at all, drive light still lit up, but the drive itself would no longer work. We basically never moved this thing in 4 years and then the one time it did fall, it went kaput. I would not trust this thing as a "portable" drive.
customer_reviews.author: DiMcN

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Personally I use it mainly to store my photographs, music, and videos. Having this makes it easier for my aging laptop to perform well, without being clogged up by all that stuff. I like to plug it into my TV and playing movies/music/etc through the TV. Same software, with better hardware (screen, speakers) than the computer. PROS: - 1TB storage - USB-3.0 transfer speed - Light weight and small size make it very portable CONS: - Proprietary cable design means it'll be inconvenient to get a replacement cable if I ever need one
customer_reviews.author: William Combs

customer_reviews.title: Failed completely twice, 2nd time couldn't repair
customer_reviews.text: Well, it happened to me, too After having to erase the disk twice after it crashed, I suffered with continued difficulties accessing the disk on my MacBook Pro, difficulites booting and retrieving data. Finally for no apparent reason, it simply would no longer boot up, and Disc Utility couldn't repair it. This HDD was used for less than a few weeks, but since I didn't begin using it for nearly a year, the return window is long closed. Buyer Beware. L H
customer_reviews.author: Susan B. Leavitt

customer_reviews.title: Works for PS4 slim extra storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a X-mas present to myself to increase my PS4 storage and give my console some longevity. I buy 95% of my games digital, and this thing is barely half full, with my collection pushing 50 games. The speed is good, I don't notice any lag, and it was easy to install - PS4 detects it immediately and formats it for you. Very satisfied. Only thing is make sure your console is somewhere the USB connection won't get bumped. It's very sensitive to movement and will automatically shut down the console if accidentally disconnected. Also make sure you've got a surge protector between the wall and your console, because a surge or brown-out will mess with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was hoping it would be. It’s small, light, and simple. It’s going to hold more data than I could ever try to put onto it. I used to have an external drive, 15 years ago. It had to be plugged into the wall. It was the size of a dictionary, it wasn’t quiet, and it was about 1/10th the capacity of this one. To make matters worse, it died and I lost everything on it. So that’s why I’m so happy with this one. If I go away and don’t want to take my computer, I just take the drive on a drive!
customer_reviews.author: JJ Wiest

customer_reviews.title: Buying an external hard drive was one of the best ideas! I take it every where with me ...
customer_reviews.text: Having a laptop and PC can be a bit confusing when my documents and pictures are spread between the two. Also, being a mom I take TONS of pictures on my IPhone and run out of storage quickly. Instead of purchasing more storage on ICloud, I preferred having them in a more accessible way, so I uploaded my pictures onto the hard drive. Buying an external hard drive was one of the best ideas! I take it every where with me and don't have to worry about having space on my IPhone, and not knowing what documents are on which computer.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great quick external storage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone, but I've bought two for myself with larger capacity. One is attached to my smart TV and holds about 400 movies. The other holds my laptop backup. Both perform exceptionally well and have outlasted a WD cloud drive by two years. The hard drives so nice, I bought them twice. Liked them so much I got one for my BIL. Transfer speed is more than sufficient to stream to my TV and backing up to the other drive is simple and quick.
customer_reviews.author: R. ODonnell

customer_reviews.title: Failed after two years of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Actual transfer speeds between two these, same model drives: avg 59 mbps, both connected to USB 3.1 ports on an MSI X99A Gaming 7 MOBO. I have purchased five of the 2TB drives to backup drone video. Always back up same data to two drives, which is a good thing since one has already failed after only rare use. Checked serial number of Seagate website, which states the drive is NOT under Warranty! 1 out of 5 failure rate is unacceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Cindyc

customer_reviews.title: Small and USB powered, using two in RAID on Mac OS
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these to store my GoPro footage. I set them up as a RAID 1, so they have the exact same content at all time. Can't tell you about the performance because of this, as RAID 1 increases the throughput. Very happy with them. They don't make any noticeable noise, even with both of them powered on. Not the case of an older WD elements I have, which is about the sound level of a quiet laptop fan or the level of sound a distant water pipe makes when your neighbor takes a shower. The Seagate though, no noise...
customer_reviews.author: Matthew from San Francisco

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Lots of storage space.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 3 since 2017. They store a lot of info so you can free up your computer. I had my mom buy one to and she loves it. I get a little nervous reading about the issues others have had but so far I haven’t had any. Crossing my fingers because if any break I will be really upset to lose my info but in3 years no problems so far. I don’t hear humming or vibrations either so maybe others got a defective one. I just wish it came with a case.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: reasonably priced usb powered drive with enough capacity for my backups
customer_reviews.text: Needed a usb drive for local backup of my home computer (local backup is performed by software that also backs up to the cloud...you definitely cannot rely solely on a local backup). I like this drive because of the capacity (4TB) and the fact that it is powered via the usb port (and doesn't require a separate power supply. So far this has worked well, I have it attached to my computer all the time for backup and various storage of other files. It's definitely compact enough to carry around if needed.
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Slower than most external HDDs I know. Very sensitive to vibration...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, I expected a faster and sturdier drive. It died 6 months after I bought it. I have no doubt it was because the cleaning ladies jostled it around too hard, but these external drives should be sturdier than that. External drives need to detect when there is excessive vibration and automatically park their heads, preventing damage. This one did not do so and I ended up with a dead drive. Also, veeeery slow. I have a 5 year old 1 TB seagate that not only is "cleaning ladies proof" but also faster than this unit. I'd stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael L Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time, go buy Western Digital instead.
customer_reviews.text: Day 1: Plugged it into my XB1 and formatted fine, but when I moved the games over to the Seagate hard-drive it said that it took down storage space but the games disappeared. Tried using my other XB1 with it and same story. Because of this crap product I have lost ALL OF MY GAMESAVES, THAT IS MULTIPLE DAYS WORTH OF GAMEPLAY, I AM PISSED. My other western digital works perfectly, listen to all the other reviews and skip the seagate and just buy a WD.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Works great for PS4 extended storage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I got tired of deleting games on my PS4 because I kept running out of space on the internal PS4 hard drive. I didn't want to fiddle with trying to install a larger capacity drive internally. So I bought this. Plugged it in to my PS4 via USB, went through the easy setup on the PS4 that formats it for use and transferred all my games to it. Took about an hour for my games to transfer and then done. I have not noticed any difference in game load time by running them off the external drive. For the price it seems like a good product for extra PS4 storage.
customer_reviews.author: George C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: So simple and easy to use for my Xbox one. You literally just have to plug it into the Xbox and you’re good to go. 4 TB is more than enough storage, I’ve had mine a year and have only used up about 30%. I love it and I haven’t had a single issue with it so I bought another one as a birthday gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this faulty device
customer_reviews.text: I ordered mine in September 2018, it was faulty and never worked, it would disconnect constantly and I tried using it with multiple computers to test it. I always got the same results after messing with the setting and telling the hard drive to continue to receive power nothing changed it always disconnected. I never got around to returning it because of my busy life. It’s currently July 2019 and it’s too late to get my money back. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: samuel

customer_reviews.title: Functional external drive
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mini with a recently dead internal HD. I bought two of these drives (2 TB), one to take over the task of the internal HD, the other for backup. These drives feel pretty lightly made, and probably couldn't take a lot of pounding or abuse, but as sidekicks for a desktop machine, they're fine. They're small, they have a low profile, they're all but silent, and while their spindle speed is only 5400 RPM, they're no worse than most internal rotational HD's. More than sufficient for most external storage needs, and even for more mission-critical uses (such as replacing a dead internal HD...).
customer_reviews.author: Warren Adams-Ockrassa

customer_reviews.title: I have three of these
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first 4 years ago and off-loaded all important files from the PC's internal drive. Bought second 2 years ago as external device for the Play Station 4. This is the third, which I will use for local file and system backups.
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: Drive failure with bonus CLICKING after only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One failed in less than 3 months. When I plug it in I can hear the read/write arm clicking on the inside. Not good. Amazon was amazing regarding returning. But because of this I've lost a ton of confidence in the 4 other Seagate drives I have. Thankfully they're doing well so far. Fingers crossed they stay that way. I opted to go with a similar Western Digital model to replace this one. It appears there have been quite a few negative reviews related to failures over the past 6 months. Perhaps quality is slipping with Seagate?
customer_reviews.author: Stephan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great drive with awesome read/write speeds
customer_reviews.text: Great drive with awesome read/write speeds. The included full size USB 3.0 cable is a nice feature as well. Keep in mind however, definition of a "MB/KB/GB/TB" is not standardized across the industry. Microsoft does not use the same specs to define 1TB as the rest of the industry so when you plug it in the writable volume is not a true 4TB because of this. Data storage manufacturers utilize the true definition of "giga" which is powers of 1000. Where as Microsoft and RAM manufacturers utilizes "gibi" which are powers of 1024. This drive is 4000GB/4TB and presents as less in Windows as a result of the 1024 conversion.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: My favorite backup hard drive yet!
customer_reviews.text: This portable hard drive is the perfect embodiment of 'big things in small packages,' with its one terabyte of storage space packed into a nearly wafer thin container. I alternate back and forth between this hard drive and another for backing up my Mac laptop, and this drive accomplishes its backups faster than my older drive--indicating excellent design in how it stores and retrieves data. I have not used this for anything other than backups, so I can't address how it is for other purposes, but I imagine it will prove exceptional in other areas, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Sue Larson

customer_reviews.title: Don't try to reformat the drive on macOS High Sierra. Use Sierra or lower.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Connected it to a Late 2016 MacBook Pro running macOS High Sierra and Disk Utility couldn't properly format the drive. I ejected it, connected it to a 2011 MacBook Air running macOS Sierra and formatted the drive as MacOS Extended Case Sensitive, Journaled, with Encryption with no issues. Time Machine is now running on the 2011 MacBook Air.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGeek

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed without warning!
customer_reviews.text: This drive seemed to be working fine for awhile. I used it occasionally to back up my laptop hard drive (I don't back up nearly as often as I should); I am hoping I didn't use it for anything other than backing up. It was mostly on a shelf (in a climate controlled area of my home) and only used once every 3-4 months. 2 years after purchase it suddenly makes a whining noise when connected and the computer does not recognize it. Unacceptable!
customer_reviews.author: mom of the monkey boys

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my Xbox One S...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Xbox One S 500GB bundle, installed this, formatted it for games and apps and was good to go. Was able to transfer with no issues from my other Xbox One to this. Time will tell how long it last. Also the fact that it didn't need a separate power source was great. It's slim and not as noticeable as my other external HDD.. will probably pick up another for that.

customer_reviews.title: Giving it 2.5 stars it is not plug and play on all devices
customer_reviews.text: This is almost like a "dead Drone" I call. The functionality is VERY POOR. Some items such as portable devices works OK but desktops? POOR., Half the time is not discoverable. Seagate used to be the cream of the crop, today not so much. It's not awful but you can get better for the money and actually CONTROL all functionality. Not impressed
customer_reviews.author: MSMisBS

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Expansion 1TB Portable External Hard Drive USB
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Seagate external USB hard drive to back up all of the digital pics and videos currently on our PC and tablets. The drive comes with the needed USB cord and hook up was a simple plug and play operation with Windows 10. I didn’t need to download any additional software and it was already pre-formatted as NTFS. Transfer speed has been very good with the USB 2.0 our system uses. The drive is working perfectly for our needs and the 1TB size should be more than adequate for the purpose, so overall I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SJK

customer_reviews.title: Defective after 2 months $600 to recover data
customer_reviews.text: Please Please Pleade do not purchase this product. Drive failed after 2 months (beeping sound then not getting recognized on my computer)I switched cables and computers and had the same issue. Turns out this is a power issue that is occurring with this drive. Seagate admitted that it was faulty but then proceeded to tell me they would charge $600 to recover my data. Google seagate power issue and you'll see numerous postings on how horrible this product and their customer service is. Save yourself the heartache and keep shopping around
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Njeri

customer_reviews.title: Good hard drive, just doesn't work with my Blu-Ray player.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get a hard drive this size for the price. So far it is working very well, and will hold my entire movie and TV collection, with room to spare. However, it doesn't work with my Blu-Ray player as an external disk. The player just won't recognize it. This is frustrating since this was my entire purpose for buying a new hard drive (one of my old ones also wouldn't read on the player). But since not everyone will be using it for this purpose, I still gave it 4 stars because it works great with my computer and doesn't have all the extra backup software, etc. that most hard drives come with.
customer_reviews.author: Versailles Baptist

customer_reviews.title: Random Lockups
customer_reviews.text: This drive is not what I expected. The biggest problem arises when the drive causes windows explorer to randomly lock up while trying to access the drive or when watching movies. When this happens, the only solution to regain control of the computer is to unplug the drive, because ejecting the drive doesn't work. The other problem is that there's no power save feature to this drive. It doesn't auto shut off like my Western Digital Passport drive. I would not recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: SpectralFlame

customer_reviews.title: Great as an external PS4 hard drive! Download and install to your heart's content!
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my PS4 and I finally have enough storage to download the majority of my games willy nilly and not have to micromanage storage space just to play a new game I got. Worth noting it does require a USB 3.0 port (may not work with a usb hub if you're using one) and it doesn't require a power supply which is fantastic. I've had it for a bit under a year and have experienced no issues with it.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I use this HDD as a back-up and mobile HDD. I bring it to work with me and also use it with my desktop PC. It's very durable. I haven't purposefully tried to give it a beating, but it's had its fair share of falls and bumps. I like the size of the enclosure, very small and fits anywhere. The textured design also helps pick it out from other devices. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BossKnight

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage, WORST HARD DRIVES EVER, 2 of 3 failed.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE DRIVES. They're big, they are cheap and they fail. I bought 3 of these and two of them have completely failed. I got them for photo storage and have lost terabytes of data using these junk hard drives. Then Seagate wants $700 for data recovery. Buy something, anything else but DO NOT BUY THESE HARD DRIVES. Should have stuck with WD or Toshiba as they've never failed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam F. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Warning-micro-usb
customer_reviews.text: I really like Seagate drives, but I never even tried using this one because it has a micro-usb connection. No mention was made anywhere that this item had a micro-usb connector. So I assumed it was a standard type A. Micro usb are too delicate in my experience and result in a shortened useful life of a product, therefore I find them unacceptable. Returned no problem, just a heads up if this matters to you as it does to me.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Bentz

customer_reviews.title: Like a little bigger than a deck of cards
customer_reviews.text: OMgosh this thing is so tiny. Like a little bigger than a deck of cards. We have a Mac so I had to reformat it (super easy) before we could connect it with Time Machine but that was the only extra step. I ziptied it to the back of the Mac and you can't even see it. Super cool.

customer_reviews.title: So Good I bought a second one!
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive was literally plug and play when using it with my X Box 1, it converted over without issue when I bought my X Box 1X. It has worked without issue for severeral years and I have over a hundred games downloaded on it without using half the storage. I recently purchased a second one for my best friend for Christmas.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a long time. I travel with my Xbox, I'm thinking the hard drive took some damage while being moved around, because one afternoon I go to play my Xbox, and the system would shut off after just loading up the home screen. I disconnected the hard drive, loads right up no problem. So I wait for the Xbox to load, then I plug the hard drive back in. Shuts my Xbox off.. so I was without an external hard drive for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Farrand

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for an external hard drive for my PS4. Had some issue initially with the PS4 recognizing the hard drive but realized it was my fault and not having the USB connected all the way. Once all the cords were connected like they should be PS4 recognized the hard drive. Was easy to format and transfer all my apps. No longer need to delete games to download new ones, this 4TB is perfect! Small and easy to carry with me if needed. So far I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mayoras

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for single projects.
customer_reviews.text: This well priced external hard drive installs easily, reads and writes rapidly, and is easily transportable. I like the 1TB size because it's large enough to hold all you need for a single project. This drive has received input from my computer, my son's, and his partner. It has been easily recognized by all three computers and goes back and forth between them as more material is added. By the end of the project, it will hold all the raw material and the final edited product in one hard drive. It's an easy and convenient way to work and makes archiving and locating material much easier than when you mix several projects into one larger drive.
customer_reviews.author: tachi1Top Contributor: Baby

When it is plugged into anyone one of my computers it constant connects and disconnects. 1/2 the time it can't even be read by any of my computers and I am not able to retrieve my personal information off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Herman

customer_reviews.title: 1 TB storage, about size of a folded wallet, "plug and use" . So quick and easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a desktop and laptop running Windows 7 and really need to back up files. Got this because it had good reviews at the lowest price for 1TB--a balance. I plugged it in, the computer had no trouble recognizing it, and I immediately began to transfrer files. So quick. So easy. And I like the size--about the same as a folded wallet. It comes with the double USB cable (about 14"). I'm very pleased and it will be a relief to finally backup my files. Losing them would be a disaster..
customer_reviews.author: Elisa 20Top Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid product
customer_reviews.text: I have several Seagate external HDDs now, ranging from 1Tb to 2Tb. After having been the victim of Ransomware, I now store all my important files externally and in triplicate, and detach the disks when not being used. To be clear, I don’t use the backup encryption facilities that come with the disks, I simply plug them into my router where I can then share them across my computers and simply drag and drop files or save directly to disk. These disks are solid, reliable and never wear out. For me, they do the job as intended, and they do it better than other brands I have purchased. For simple, reliable storage, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: It only lasted 18 months plugged into one console...
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive was purchased strictly for extra space on our Xbox One console. It has been plugged into this console and not ported around for the last 18 months. customer_reviews.text: I have had the hard drive for 6 months now and use it daily. Worked as advertised until about two weeks ago when the port on the hard drive must have become loose. Now it only works when you actively press and hold the chord into the hard drive, if I don't do this the device will not connect to my computer. I have tried other hard drives on my computer with this chord and they still work. I have also tried using other chords with this hard drive but this does not fix the issue so it must be the port on the hard drive. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works as a DISH Wally DVR
customer_reviews.text: Great little drive and it works with my Wally with a few undocumented easy steps. I formatted it on my Mac using Disk Utility--first as a Mac drive and then as a PC exFAT and renamed it "1 TB DVR Upgrade Expansion" (just in case, because if you buy theirs--that's what it's named without the quotes of course). Then I plugged it into my download completed Wally and got the pop up saying an external DVR has been detected. Call DISH to activate. Once it's activated, another pop up will ask if you want to format the drive. Yes, yes, and then yes! Finally, you have to restart your Wally and you're done. It works!
customer_reviews.author: renwor49

customer_reviews.title: Fragile beyond reasonableness
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4 of these - just had another failure. They work fine as long as you don't drop them (and I don't mean out the 2nd story window) or jar them very hard. Once that happens not only is all the data gone, but you can't even reformat the device to start over. Had one replaced under warranty no questions. I use these for backup at the office, rotating units kept at home. I'm now looking for an alternative that is a little more shock resistant. (Yes, I have other backup solutions that run in redundancy, but still want this solution too.)
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Mindblowing: 4TB storage in a compact physical package at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: These have become my "go to" external drives. A huge amount of storage in a compact physical package at a reasonable price. They are not fast enough, in my opinion, for use with video editing or intensive photo manipulation, but for mass storage, they are perfect. I have four of them now and will be acquiring more in the future. Jerry

They probably want my SSN too. Seagate, I gave you MY money. How about giving me some support before demanding my phone number and email. Apple disk utility will not recognize drive. NTFS software (Seagate’s “fix”) also will not recognize drive. My older Seagate drive works just fine. And I remember having no trouble reformatting that drive. What a waste of money. What a waste of time. Three hours out of my workday.

customer_reviews.title: YOU CAN'T DO BETTER THAN THIS FOR PRICE AND SPACE. BOTH  TERRIRIC!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a refurbished computer that has been a nightmare and it turned out to have a really small hard drive so I had to buy an expansion drive. I picked this because it had a large capacity and it's been great. I had Bask (a company who you pay monthly and they will do everything they can to fix and figure out any problems). All in all this was a great price and a great product and I am thrilled that once again, as usual, Amazon has had just what I need!!

customer_reviews.text: I was already feeling a sense of trepidation when I order this drive due to the accounts of failed drives. I was enticed by the price, but as with a lot of things in life, I definitely got what I paid for. Now at a little over a year later, my drive has failed and I have almost certainly lost the more recent files I have on there. Luckily, I hung on to my very old drives that are STILL working, so it's not a total loss. Believe the reviews, these drives are not reliable and certainly not to be trusted with your precious data. I can only imagine if I had gotten rid of my old drives.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: It’ll just give you a frustration headache
customer_reviews.text: Hard drive would not operate with my computer, or the several others I tried it on. I may not be a tech whiz, but I’m also not a complete dummy when it comes to computers. I tried several computers to no avail. I ended up having to return it. I know aesthetics are no indication of operability, but the hard drive just feels light and cheap. I would not recommend this hard drive to anyone unless you like headaches and potentially faulty products.
